dialogue: Security say they’d like to test the electronic jammers one last time, your Eminence.
Then they’d better be quick. Is this really necessary, Willi?
Apparently so. Security say... ...eavesdroppers can use lasers to “read the vibrations on the glass?”
Let’s hope none of our brothers suffer from claustrophobia. Who knows how long we’ll have to be in here.
I assume we are going to finish in time?
They will work through the night if they have to. It will be fine, Eminence. It always is. Italy, you know.
Sorry to fuss. .
Here they come, Your Eminence.
Brothers, welcome.
One hundred and three, Eminence.
I wonder where Tedesco has got to.
His name is Vincent Benitez, Eminence. He’s the Archbishop of Kabul.
Archbishop of where?
Kabul. He’s Mexican. The Holy Father appointed him last year.
Last year? And how has this been kept a secret?
I thought, perhaps, you would be aware of his elevation.
No. I am not.
Ray, ask Father Bellini to join us. Perhaps he knew of this.
He has a letter of appointment from the Pope addressed to the archdiocese of Kabul, which they kept secret at the Hol y Father’s request. You don’t think he could have forged it?
Where is he now?
